From the Anki.com Privacy Policy Dated June 8, 2015:
 
"Personal information is information about you that can be used by itself, or combined with other information, to personally identify you. We collect this information directly from you when you provide it to us.
 
When you purchase an Anki product from Anki.com, you provide us with your name, email, phone number, shipping and billing addresses, credit card information, and other information you affirmatively provide. When you register to receive Anki news we collect age and email address. When you sign up for an Anki account (an "Account" or a "Connected Profile"), we will collect your Driver Name, email address, birthdate, and password. If you choose to have a physical DRV license delivered to you or your child via mail, we will collect your mailing address to deliver a license to you or your child.
 
If you choose to purchase Anki DRIVE as a gift and send to a third party, we will ask you for friend or family member's name and shipping information. We do not use the shipping information for any secondary purpose.
 
We may also collect your Internet Protocol ('IP') address. We use your IP address to diagnose problems with our servers, software, to administer our Services and to gather demographic information.
 
We do not collect more personal information than is reasonably necessary to participate in an activity on the Website or App or enhance your gameplay experience.
 
Specific to the Anki DRIVE App
 
When you use the Anki DRIVE App we collect your non-unique driver nickname (please do not use your real name), device make and model, Apple vendor ID, vehicle ID, operating system version, and language your device is set to. In addition, we collect app and gameplay data to help improve our products and services. This information may include, but is not limited to, game scores, game achievements, game performance, and your usage of various game features. All information collected by Anki automatically or passively (such as information collected prior to when you create an Account) is intended to be anonymous information that does not disclose your identity or constitute personal information. It will automatically be transmitted to Anki and used as described herein. The information collected by Anki may be posted in an anonymous and aggregated format by Anki on publicly-accessible web sites such as Facebook, shared with hardware manufacturers, shared with platform hosts, shared with Anki's marketing partners or used by Anki for any other lawful purpose.
 
We use mobile analytics software to allow us to better understand the functionality of our Application on your mobile device. This software may record information such as how often you use the Anki DRIVE app, the events that occur within the application, aggregated usage, and performance data. We do not link the information we store within the analytics software to any personally identifiable information you submit within the Anki DRIVE app without your explicit permission or the permission of a parent or legal guardian.
 
We do obtain non-personally identifiable zip-code level geographic information using devices' IP addresses. You may turn off location services at the device level.
 
If you choose to use our results sharing feature, the Anki DRIVE App will provide you with options to share your race results via text messaging, email, or social applications you have on your mobile device.
 
You will have the ability to save images to your device in our sharing of results feature. If you wish to do so, you will receive a notification indicating that the application would like to access your photos which you may allow or deny. We do not access other photos, that you may have saved to your device, we only allow you to save the image you create within our mobile application to our device.
 
We send push notifications to provide you with alerts and information. You may opt-out of push notifications at the device level.
 
Automatically as you navigate through the site: usage Details Cookies, Cookies and Other Technologies
 
When you visit our Website, certain information is or can be automatically recorded. Generally, we use this information in an aggregated and anonymized way. If we need to combine this type of information with personal information, we treat it as such. Automatically collected information includes:
Statistical or technical information such as, for example, your computer's Internet Protocol address, operating system and browser type, time and date, and how you navigate through and interact with the Website.
Information collected via "cookies" or "web beacons," which are small data files that we transfer to your computer for record keeping purposes. We primarily use cookies for login session management. Anki does not collect personal information from you on our Site via cookies or web beacons, however, we may combine the information collected through cookies with other personal information you provide us (for example, we may link cookie information to your account information so we can remember what you’ve stored in your shopping cart). You can change the options on your browser to stop accepting cookies or to prompt you before accepting a cookie from a website. If you do not accept cookies, however, you may not be able to use all portions or functionality of our Website.
 
Accounts
 
You can sign up for a Connected Profile to backup stats, track progress on multiple devices, and reserve a unique Driver Name. If you sign up for an Anki Account via the App or Website, we will collect your Driver Name, email address, birthdate, and password. If you choose to have a physical DRV license delivered to you or your child via mail, we will collect your mailing address to deliver a license to you or your child.
 
Once you sign up for an Account (and, in the case of children users, a parent authorizes the account), your gameplay data is connected to your Driver name and email address in your Account. We may contact you from time to time via email based on your gameplay data.
 
You may modify your Account information or request deletion of your Account by emailing us at support@anki.com.
 
From Third Parties, such as our business partners: Advertiser Use of Cookies and Other Tracking Technologies.
 
When you visit our website, we use third parties to collect anonymized and aggregated demographic and Website use information such as, for example, type of browser and operating system, location, referring website, Internet service provider (or, in the case of mobile devices, mobile carrier, UDID), and type of device. We do not control these third parties' tracking technologies or how they may be used.
 
We may partner with a third party ad networks to manage our advertising on other sites and retarget visitors to our site. Our ad network partners use cookies and Web beacons to collect non-personally identifiable information about your activities on this and other Web sites to provide you targeted advertising based upon your interests. If you wish to not have this information used for the purpose of serving you targeted ads, you may opt-out by clicking here, or by visiting our list of 3rd Party Operators here. Please note this does not opt you out of being served advertising. You will continue to receive generic ads. We do not engage in retargeted advertising for children users of our Site or App.
 
We use Google Analytics with anonymized IP. Google Analytics is a web analysis service provided by Google Inc. (“Google”). We use Google Analytics to track and examine the use of our Application. This integration of Google Analytics anonymizes your IP address. It works by shortening all Users' IP addresses, including those within Member States of the European Union or in other Contracting States to the Agreement on the European Economic Area."
